intro: Stachytarpheta × intercedens, commonly known as the hybrid blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flower clusters that resemble mist. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical gardens.
